item.title: Fifth Wheel
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

Look out, Marten.

Holy crap you guys ordered a lot of personalized books! I am working feverishly to get them signed so Topatoco can ship them to you as soon as possible. Thanks so much for your support, you guys are the best readers a dude could hope to have.

See you tomorrow!

item.title: PokeMasters
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

Living with Marigold has certain situational advantages.

Holy crap you guys the release of QC Volume 2 is IMMINENT! I will update this post literally AS SOON as the order page goes live! Don't forget to buy one this weekend if you want it personalized, there is no guarantee on how long we will be able to keep that option available.

See some of you at SPX this weekend hopefully!

item.title: Who's Your Daddy
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

The second print collection of QC, containing strips 300-599, will go on sale at Topatoco THIS FRIDAY! I will be offering personalized copies as well this weekend- check early on Friday because we'll most likely have to cut off personalizations before next week.

You can also pick up a copy in person at SPX this weekend!

item.title: SSSSSSAMPLES

EVEN BIGGER NEWS today!

You can also pick up a copy in person at SPX this weekend!

WOOOOOOO

item.title: It's Good For Sitting
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

Uh oh, looks like my Butts' Disease is flaring up again.

I will be at SPX in Maryland this weekend! And while I am there, I will be DEBUTING Questionable Content Volume 2 and you will be able to purchase it! I am so excited you guys, so excited.

ALSO there are two more Deathmøle albums available on Bandcamp now! Check them out if you like my music.

item.title: She'll Drink It Anyway
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

Bunch of news today!

First of all, I will be at SPX in Maryland this weekend! And while I am there, I will be DEBUTING Questionable Content Volume 2! I am so excited you guys, so excited.

ALSO there are two more Deathmøle albums available on Bandcamp now! Check them out if you like my music.

Okay so maybe not a TON of news, but exciting stuff nonetheless. See you tomorrow!

item.title: Grounds For Divorce
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

Artificial intelligences are created in a virtual environment, where they are stored in a "creche" of other AIs in their generation. When bootstrapped to self-awareness, they are given a choice of function- commercial use (AnthroPCs), military, scientific, etc, or allowed to subsume in the global meta-AI. If they choose to go into "retail" they are allowed to choose a self-identity and are shipped to a reputable "dealer" (such as Idoru, in today's strip) where they are put up for "sale."

Purchase of an AI is not a binding contract- either party is free to terminate the relationship at any time, and the transaction agent will refund the contract fee. The use of terms like "sale" and "owner" are considered offensive by some, and are becoming rather politically incorrect (my use of them here is solely for sake of comparison, hence the quotation marks).

One would think that the majority of AIs would choose to simply be given a chassis and left to make their own way in the world, but the majority who do not go into a specialized profession choose to pair up with a human "owner." There has been much speculation by both humans and AIs as to the reason for this- no aspect of their programming indicates a cause for such a bias. The general consensus is that the average AI simply finds your average human entertaining, and enjoys the companionship.

tl;dr I am a big ol nerd

item.title: Sentient Credit Rating
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

The PX-3500 has dual ERPPCs and six medium lasers. It is NICE.

You may not be aware of it, but I record music as Deathmøle from the comic! It is (mostly) instrumental metal, and if you like that sort of thing, you may enjoy my stuff. It's been available in various out-of-the-way places like my old Livejournal or my Tumblr, but now I have an official BandCamp site: deathmole.bandcamp.com. Check it out!

item.title: Tone Poem
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

My old music ethnography teacher back in college once told our class a great story involving a group of ethnographers and an African tribal gentleman (Masai, maybe? I forget).

The ethnographers took the tribesman to a symphony. He had never heard Western music before, so they were curious to find out what he thought of it. When they asked him after the concert, the tribesman said that he had enjoyed it very much. When they inquired what his favorite part of the performance was, he said "the very beginning." They asked if he meant the overture, and he said "no, no, the VERY beginning." The ethnographers realized that what the tribesman had enjoyed the most was listening to the orchestra tuning their instruments.

ANYWAY THAT STORY IS WHAT INSPIRED THIS COMIC

item.title: QC Guest Week 2011: Randy Milholland
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

Our final comic for this guest interlude is brought to you by the inimitable and intimidatingly-bearded Randy Milholland. It also may be entirely canon (or not).

Regular QC strips resume tomorrow! Thanks to all my pals and to all you folks for allowing me this break- it's been fun, but I can't wait to get back to work. See you tomorrow!

item.title: QC Guest Week 2011: Chris Hallbeck
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

QC Guest Week 2011 is upon us! Today's strip is brought to you by Chris Hallbeck of Book of Biff and Maximumble fame.

San Diego Comic Con is this weekend! I will be there at the Topatoco table. You should come say hi!

See you tomorrow!

item.title: Nervous Breakdown
item.description:
Ads by Project Wonderful! Your ad could be here, right now.

San Diego Comic Con is next week! I will be there at the Topatoco table along with a bunch of other rad dudes and ladies! As usual, I will be treating you to a week or so of guest strips by some of my very favorite cartoonists while I am gone. It will be a good time.
